items.sentence: The person reading a book on the bench under the tree is Tom.
The person who donated this money wishes to remain anonymous.
The room was so dark that we had to feel our way to the door.
The street behind my house is too narrow for delivery trucks.
Tom believes that there is a time and a place for everything.
Tom said he\'d be willing to do anything Mary asks him to do.
Tom said he\'d think it over and give us his answer tomorrow.
Tom said that he doesn\'t think doing that is worth his time.
Tom said that he\'d never eaten such a delicious meal before.
Tom asked Mary to tell him where she had hidden the diamonds.
Tom asked me this morning if I wanted to go jogging with him.
Tom bought some cheap reading glasses at the local drugstore.
I\'ll probably be back in Boston a couple of times next year.
I\'m not going to tell you what happened until you calm down.
I\'ve only spoken to Tom twice since he started working here.
Tom threw his hands up into the air and said that he gave up.
Tom took off his shoes and socks and rolled up his pant legs.
It wouldn\'t be a good idea to tell Tom what really happened.
It\'s amazing how Tom was able to do that with just one hand.
It\'s better to be approximately right than completely wrong.
